intro: Cordemoya spinulosa, commonly known as the spiny cordemoya, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy, pale pink or white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a velvety texture. Cordemoya spinulosa is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
